title: Book Online at Carolina Family Acupuncture
description: Acupuncture and Holistic Medicine offered in the upstate of South Carolina
cleaned_text: Dawn Garrison is a Doctor of Acupuncture and Oriental medicine specializing in women's health, pediatric care, stress, anxiety and cancer support. She holds an active acupuncture licenses in both South Carolina and California and is a Board certified Diplomate of Oriental Medicine and Herbal Medicine by the National Commission of Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine (NCCAOM). She holds a master's degree in Traditional Chinese Medicine (MTCM) from Five Branches University in California since 2010 and a Doctorate (DAOM) from Emperors College in California since 2017. Dawn uses acupuncture and her understanding of Chinese medicine to restore homeostasis to her patients. She empowers patients to take charge of their health, while her love of Chinese medicine provides a safe environment that facilitates healing on multiple levels. Clinically, Dawn Garrison has extensive experience, having worked at one of the busiest family acupuncture clinics in the San Jose area and running a successful solo practice in San Diego Ca working in an integrative setting with other healthcare professionals. In 2012, Dawn was part of the medical team at the O'Neill Coldwater Classic (Santa Cruz, CA): an event that draws the top professional surfers in the world. She welcomes children to her practice, and offers several therapies that do not require needles. Dawn Garrison is a Doctor of Acupuncture and Oriental medicine specializing in women's health, pe... I received my Chinese Medicine education Daoist Traditions in Asheville, NC where I also completed a two-year clinical internship. While earning my Doctoral Degree I received special training in Cardiology, Neurology, Endocrinology, Gynecology, Obstetrics, Pediatrics and Orthopedics. While I enjoy working with all types of cases, I do have a special interest in pain management, anxiety and depression, and women's health. [ Read More ](#/staff_member/5/bio) My name is Jasmine Villarreal and I am a licensed acupuncture therapist in the states of North and South Carolina and am certified by the National Certification Commission for Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine (NCCAOM). Upon completion of classical training in Chinese acupuncture and herbal medicine and a two year clinical internship, I received my Master's degree from Daoist Traditions College of Chinese Medical Arts. Additionally, I hold a Bachelor's degree in general psychology from the University of North Carolina at Asheville. After completion of my undergraduate degree, I worked as an autism support professional for the Autism Society of North Carolina for four years until I was inspired to pursue higher education in integrative health care beginning in 2017. My various educational and clinical experiences have given me an affinity for working with many conditions including but not limited to GI disturbances, women's health, stress and anxiety, autoimmune disorders, and chronic pain. In treatment sessions, a combination of modern and ancient techniques including acupuncture, adjunctive therapies like cupping and gut sha, and herbal medicine are utilized to provide optimal results for each individual. I believe that balance and harmony are key to good health. I seek to nurture these qualities within the health of each patient as well as my own. I believe that a deeper knowledge and understanding of our bodies', both in states of balance and imbalance, can connect us to greater states of well-being. I encourage these ideas in treatment sessions through education, bodywork, mindfulness and reflectiveness to illuminate new paths for positive change. I look forward to working with you helping you attain your healing goals at Carolina Family Acupuncture! Outside of the clinic, you can find me, listening to music, dancing, taking long walks, practicing yoga, cooking, learning something new, spending time in nature, and spending quality time with family and friends.
